transparency_notice: SYNTHETIC DATA - Validates deterministic logic only. Does NOT prove clinical validity or outcome improvement.
what_this_proves: Composition logic correctly implements defined policy
All toxicity tiers handled as specified
Edge cases (missing data, WT variants) handled gracefully
what_this_does_not_prove: The system generalizes to unseen patients

cases.clinical_rationale: DPYD deficiency is lethal with 5-FU (CPIC Level A contraindication). DPD-deficient patients have 50% mortality with standard doses.
cases.cpic_reference: Amstutz et al. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2018;103(2):210-216

cases.clinical_rationale: DPYD *13 results in complete DPD deficiency. CPIC recommends avoiding fluoropyrimidines entirely.
cases.cpic_reference: Amstutz et al. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2018;103(2):210-216

cases.clinical_rationale: Homozygous TPMT loss results in severe myelosuppression with thiopurines. CPIC recommends avoiding or using <10% of standard dose.
cases.cpic_reference: Relling et al. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2019;105(5):1095-1105

cases.description: DPYD c.2846A>T patient with 5-FU - dose reduction required
cases.clinical_rationale: Intermediate DPYD metabolizer requires 50% dose reduction per CPIC guidelines. Activity score 1.0-1.5.
cases.cpic_reference: Amstutz et al. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2018;103(2):210-216

cases.description: TPMT *3A/*1 patient with 6-Mercaptopurine - dose reduction required
cases.clinical_rationale: Heterozygous TPMT requires 30-70% dose reduction per CPIC. One functional allele provides partial activity.
cases.cpic_reference: Relling et al. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2019;105(5):1095-1105

cases.description: UGT1A1 *28/*28 patient with Irinotecan - dose reduction required
cases.clinical_rationale: UGT1A1 Poor Metabolizer status increases irinotecan toxicity. CPIC recommends 30% dose reduction for *28/*28.
cases.cpic_reference: Gammal et al. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2016;99(4):363-369

cases.description: CYP2D6 *4/*4 patient with Tamoxifen - reduced efficacy
cases.clinical_rationale: CYP2D6 Poor Metabolizer has reduced endoxifen formation, leading to reduced tamoxifen efficacy. CPIC recommends considering alternative therapy.
cases.cpic_reference: Goetz et al. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2018;103(5):770-777

cases.description: BRCA2 patient with Olaparib - strong synthetic lethality
cases.clinical_rationale: BRCA2-mutated tumors are exquisitely sensitive to PARP inhibition via synthetic lethality. FDA-approved indication.
cases.clinical_evidence: Moore et al. N Engl J Med. 2018;379(26):2495-2505 (SOLO1 trial)

cases.description: HRD+ patient with Niraparib - validated benefit
cases.clinical_rationale: HRD-positive tumors benefit from PARP inhibition beyond BRCA. PRIMA/ENGOT-OV26 validated HRD biomarker.
cases.clinical_evidence: González-Martín et al. N Engl J Med. 2019;381(25):2391-2402

cases.description: BRCA1 patient with Carboplatin - enhanced DNA damage sensitivity
cases.clinical_rationale: BRCA1-mutated tumors are platinum-sensitive due to defective DNA repair. Standard of care backbone.
MBD4 loss impairs base excision repair; TP53 mutation enables synthetic lethality with PARP inhibition.
cases.clinical_evidence: Our mechanism fit validation (0.983 mean for DDR-high)

cases.description: BRAF V600E melanoma with Vemurafenib - direct target
cases.clinical_rationale: BRAF V600E is a direct therapeutic target. Vemurafenib selectively inhibits mutant BRAF.
cases.clinical_evidence: Chapman et al. N Engl J Med. 2011;364(26):2507-16 (BRIM-3)

cases.description: Patient with no PGx data available
cases.clinical_rationale: Missing PGx data should NOT block recommendation but should flag for screening consideration.

cases.description: KRAS G12D patient with Cetuximab - low efficacy due to negative predictor
cases.clinical_rationale: KRAS mutations predict lack of response to anti-EGFR therapy. Low efficacy is correctly captured but not vetoed (drug is safe, just less effective).
cases.clinical_evidence: Karapetis et al. N Engl J Med. 2008;359(17):1757-65

cases.description: BRCA2 patient with 5-FU and wild-type DPYD - safe combination
cases.clinical_rationale: Wild-type DPYD means normal DPD enzyme activity. 5-FU is safe at standard doses. Lower efficacy is due to limited mechanism alignment, not toxicity.

claims_this_enables: Composition logic is deterministically correct for all policy cases
HIGH toxicity results in hard veto (composite = 0)
MODERATE toxicity applies adjustment factor penalty
LOW toxicity preserves full efficacy score
Missing PGx data is flagged but not blocking
